intro: Pavetta micheliana, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pavetta micheliana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and riverbanks.
